qas.question: What address did Frédéric live at during his stay in Paris?
How far down the road did Liszt live from Frédéric during this time?
How many times did Frédéric and Liszt collaborate in performances during the years of 1833 to 1841?
For whose benefit was the first of these concerts performed for on 2 April 1833?
At which two establishments was the last of these performances conducted at on 25 and 26 April 1841?

answers.text: Salle Pleyel and the Paris Conservatory

qas.question: When was the first time Liszt and Chopin performed together?
What was the charity that Liszt and Chopin last performed for?
Where did Liszt and Chopin last perform together?

answers.text: Salle Pleyel and the Paris Conservatory

qas.question: When Liszt lived close to Chopin, where did he call home?

answers.text: the Hôtel de France on the Rue Lafitte

qas.question: How many times did Chopin and Liszy perform together in public?
Who did the first concert of Chopin and Liszt benefit?

context: The two became friends, and for many years lived in close proximity in Paris, Chopin at <a0_0>38 Rue de la Chaussée-d'Antin<a0_0/>, and Liszt at <a8_0>the Hôtel de France on the Rue Lafitte<a8_0/>, <a1_0>a few blocks<a1_0/> away. They performed together on <a2_0><a9_0>seven<a9_0/><a2_0/> occasions between 1833 and 1841. The first, on <a5_0>2 April 1833<a5_0/>, was at a benefit concert organized by Hector Berlioz for his bankrupt Shakespearean actress wife <a3_0><a10_0>Harriet Smithson<a10_0/><a3_0/>, during which they played George Onslow's Sonata in F minor for piano duet. Later joint appearances included a benefit concert for the Benevolent Association of Polish Ladies in Paris. Their last appearance together in public was for a charity concert conducted for <a6_0>the Beethoven Memorial in Bonn<a6_0/>, held at the <a4_0><a7_0>Salle Pleyel and the Paris Conservatory<a7_0/><a4_0/> on 25 and 26 April 1841.
